name: Lytix
headline: DataDog for LLMs, turnkey solution for n=1 custom evaluations
description: Lytix is Datadog for LLMs. We give developers time, money and certainty when building with AI. Developers are using lytix to build custom evaluations, identify opportunities to save money, and optimize their KPIs. Our approach has helped customers reduce errors by up to 85%.

founders.name: Sahil Sinha, Founder
founders.description:
Grew up between India and the UK.
Claremont McKenna College '20. 
Intuit Rotational PM Program '20-'22

# Get Started‚Üí

Evaluation Layer
# Why do I need an evaluation layer?
Ensure quality and reliability in your AI systems with comprehensive evaluation
# Custom evaluations give you more coverage than off the shelf models
# Evaluate specific and subjective qualities of your workflows
# Regular Updates
# Get peace of mind via regular updates, that your system is being actively monitored
Your Journey
# We'll meet you where you are - whether you're just getting started or already live.
Here's how thinking about evals can help you at any point in your LLMOps journey.
### [Still evaluating if LLMs are right for usHow evaluations fit into your LLMOps strategyLearn more‚Üí](https://lytix.co/<https:/blog.lytix.co/posts/evals_llmops>)### [Currently experimenting and prototypingPrototype -> Production: an evaluation-driven approach to building reliable systemsLearn more‚Üí](https://lytix.co/<https:/blog.lytix.co/posts/prototype_to_prod>)### [Already live with some monitoring in placeHow to get more from your observability tools via evaluationsLearn more‚Üí](https://lytix.co/<https:/blog.lytix.co/posts/llmops-data-maxing>)

# Getting Started
Get up and running in minutes with our simple SDK
OpenAIVercel AIGemini
1
### Initialize the SDK
Quickly integrate with minimal lines of code
PythonTypeScript
```
```
from openai import OpenAI
client = OpenAI(
 # Update your base url to the lytix proxy
 base_url=f"https://api.lytix.co/proxy/v1/openai",
 # Update your api key to the lytix api key
 api_key="$LYTIX_API_KEY",
 default_headers={
  # Move your openai key to the default headers
  "openaiKey": "$OPENAI_API_KEY"
 },
)
```
`
```

2
### Query
You're ready to start querying models
PythonTypeScript
```
```
response = client.chat.completions.create(
 model="gpt-4",
 messages=[
  {
   "role": "system",
   "content": "You are a helpful assistant. Always JSON",
  },
  {
   "role": "user",
   "content": "Hello world!",
  },
 ],
)
```
`
```

3
### Switch providers or models
Never get locked into a single provider and model. Instantly gain access to 10+ models
PythonTypeScript
```
```
from optimodel import ModelTypes
response = client.chat.completions.create(
 # Single line change to switch models
 model=ModelTypes.mistral_large_latest.name,
 messages=[
  ...
 ],
)
```
`
```

View Openai Quickstart Guide‚ö°

generated_description:
Lytix is a New York-based startup that emerged from the Y Combinator W24 batch and was founded in 2024. The company's mission is straightforward yet ambitious‚Äîthink of them as the DataDog for Large Language Models (LLMs). By providing a highly customizable evaluation layer for LLMs, Lytix aims to give developers back their time, money, and confidence while building AI-powered solutions.

The core offering is an evaluation platform that helps developers create custom evaluations tailored to their unique needs. This isn't just about generic checks; it's about diving deep into specific metrics that matter, allowing businesses to identify ways to cut costs and enhance key performance indicators (KPIs). The results speak for themselves: customers have reported error reductions of up to 85%. That‚Äôs a significant leap toward reliability.

Lytix is all about enabling developers to monitor and optimize AI workflows continuously. Their tool seamlessly integrates with a range of models, providing flexibility that prevents lock-in with any single solution. Whether you‚Äôre still figuring out if LLMs are the right fit for your project, experimenting with prototypes, or ready for full-scale deployment, Lytix has resources to guide you every step of the way.

With a compact team of just two people, Lytix relies on the mentorship of Dalton Caldwell, a notable figure in the startup ecosystem. The company is dedicated to being at the forefront of AI development tools, and its open-source approach is an appealing aspect for developers looking to contribute or customize their solutions further.

If you‚Äôre interested in leveraging Lytix for your evaluation needs, you can explore their offerings on their website: [Lytix.co](https://lytix.co/). They provide documentation, a blog with insights into leveraging evaluations, and an SDK designed for rapid integration. For developers navigating the complex landscape of AI, Lytix represents a promising roadmap to building more reliable and effective systems.
